required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multiple Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of AMG 785
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Ascending Multiple Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of AMG 785 in Healthy Men and Postmenopausal Women With Low Bone Mass

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, ascending multiple dose study assesses the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and pharmacodynamics of subcutaneous administration of 6 doses of 1 mg/kg AMG 785 once every 2 weeks or 3 doses of 3 mg/kg AMG 785 every 4 weeks in healthy men or postmenopausal women with low bone mass and 3 doses of 2 mg/kg AMG 785 every 4 weeks or 6 doses of 2 mg/kg AMG 785 every 2 weeks in healthy postmenopausal women with low bone mass.

primary_outcome.measure: Number (percent) of subjects reporting treatment-emergent adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: 169 days following initial investigational product administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number (percent) of subjects who experienced clinically significant changes in safety laboratory tests, physical examinations, vital signs, or electrocardiograms
primary_outcome.time_frame: 169 days following initial investigational product administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number (percent) of subjects who developed antibodies to AMG 785
primary_outcome.time_frame: 169 days following initial investigational product administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the serum concentration-time curve (AUC), maximum observed concentration (Cmax), and time of maximum drug concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 169 days following initial investigational product administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone mineral density as assessed by dual energy X-ray absorptiometry, serum procollagen type 1 N-terminal propeptide, osteocalcin, bone-specific alkaline phosphatase, serum CTX, intact Parathyroid Hormone, serum and ionized calcium, and sclerostin levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 169 days following initial investigational product administration

arm_group.description: 16 subjects will be randomized to receive AMG 785 or placebo in a 3:1 ratio and will receive 6 doses of 1 mg/kg
16 subjects will be randomized to receive AMG 785 or placebo in a 3:1 ratio and will receive 3 doses of 3 mg/kg
8 subjects will be randomized to receive AMG 785 or placebo in a 3:1 ratio and will receive 6 doses of 2 mg/kg
8 subjects will be randomized to receive AMG 785 or placebo in a 3:1 ratio and will receive 3 doses of 2 mg/kg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy males and females between 45 to 80 years of age
- Postmenopausal females
- Low bone mineral density
- 25-hydroxyvitamin D ≥ 20 ng/mL
- Weight ≤ 98 kg (216 lb) and/or height ≤ 196 cm (77 in)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Osteoporosis
- Subjects with fewer than 2 evaluable (by DXA) vertebrae; metal in hips bilaterally that would not allow for at least one evaluable (by DXA) hip; metal in forearms bilaterally that would not allow for at least one evaluable (by DXA) forearm
- Previous exposure to AMG 785
